name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Foreign relations not trending well.  Domestic relations not trending well. Fiscal policy not trending well.  And another $2 Trillion budget expansion, intentionally mislabeled, is going to make it all better?

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: I know many people who are leaving California.  At the same time I know people moving to California. Huh.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Muhammad Ali’s brilliant labeling is bouncing around in my head.  I can almost hear him calling the recent China-US meeting  “The Disasta’ in Alaska”.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: U.S. Nominal GDP totaled around $101 Trillion cumulatively over the past five years.  U.S. Nominal Total Unfunded Liabilities have increased by around $38 Trillion over the past five years.  U.S. Total Unfunded Liabilies are now 775% of last twelve month’s GDP.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: “Those who cannot remember the past are doomed to repeat it.”  George Santayana

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: It is shocking that Tommy James (Hanky Panky, Mony Mony, Crimson and Clover, I Think We’re Alone Now, Crystal Blue Persuasion, Draggin’ the Line) has never even been nominated for induction into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The American Psychological Association reports that in a recent survey they conducted fully 48% of Millennials say they’ve had undesired weight gain during the pandemic, with the average weight gain being a mind blowing 41 pounds.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: For decades U.S. trading partners in Asia were vendor financing our excessive consumption via Treasury Bond purchases. They’ve been curtailing that financing for a few years now, and have been replaced as the U.S. excessive consumption financier by the Federal Reserve.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Did you know 57% of all Federal Gov’t spending over the last 12 months was unfunded, i.e. deficit spending? Well, it’s true. And that percentage is growing quickly.  On the current trajectory it could be 80% in 5 years. Why not make it 100% and be done with taxes altogether?

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The price of gold is down 11% over the past twelve months.  The S&P 500 is up 27% over the past twelve months.  Bitcoin is up 467% over the past twelve months. Great dispersions often precede great reversions. We shall see.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Seems like a long time since the major U.S. Stock Market Averages have moved in unison, even for a day.  Regime change underway.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Trick question:  How much are 30 year UST yields down over the last four and a half years?  That’s right...they are up.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: First, months ago, the 30 year UST yield thrusted higher. Then the 10 year. Then, today, the 7 year. Which, by proximity, made the 5 year UST yield explode to the upside. This is a regime change.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The United States’ unfounded (seems a better term than unfunded) liabilities are increasing at the rate of $1 Million every four seconds.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Feeling Marty Zweig early October 1987.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Even without any further stimulus, the Federal Government’s Debt will cross over $28 Trillion in 16 days. If the $2 Trillionish stimulus passes it will hurdle $30 Trillion in no time.  Meanwhile, total US unfounded liabilities will cross over $160 Trillion in 30 days.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Actual US Gov’t spending last 12 months: $8.1 Trillion. Yeah, like 40% of GDP.  Actual fiscal deficit last 12 months: $4.6 Trillion. Yeah, like 20% of GDP.  Another 10% coming soon through reconciliation, too. And infrastructure?  Most important but always last.  No end in sight.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: I am a long term dollar bear and gold bull but have been neutral on both for over six months. Lots of liquid poured into a funnel creates a torrent. Bitcoin maybe The Stimulus Asset. Doesn’t look like gold is.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: To be clear, the name change would reflect Robinhood robbing the little guy, nothing else.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Robin Hood (sic) should be forced to change its name to Hood Robbin’.  I grow so weary of lies through nomenclature, which are ubiquitous these days.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Go Big or Go Home, I guess.  Looks like a $1.9 Trillion stimulus train is making its way down the tracks.  If so, 2021 starts out with about a 10% of GDP deficit expansion in a little over a month.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Advice among the greatest ever:  “When you’re in a hole, stop digging.”

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The Bills got beat by a better team; all there is to it.  Congratulations to the Chiefs and their fans.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Asian demand for longer dated US Treauries seems to be rising due to somewhat higher US yields and a lower dollar.  Yield peak in place, at least for the short term.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Colts lines played well on both sides of the ball. Never thought Reich would choke like he did. Decisions to go for the TD on fourth (from not that close) and to go for two early cost them 4 points. “Analytics” are overrated when facing an above average opponent.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: I am old enough and have memory enough to see current markets in the context of history.  CNBC Monday.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: When I was a kid it was called GNP (Gross National Product).  Later it became called GDP (Gross Domestic Product). We need to add another measure as a subset in the GDP reports:  GS”P”(Gross Spending “Product”).

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: US economy should be “strong” in the first half of 2021.  Money sent all across the country by the Treasury Dept, loaned by the Fed, will likely only increase. Lots of that gets spent, boosting nominal GDP.  But that is not “production”.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: To quote Steve Tasker: “Better be ready.  It might be chilly.”

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Looking like The Mighty Bills will wake up tomorrow as the #2 seed in the AFC.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Hope they’re not peaking too early, but right now the Bills are playing better than any other team in the NFL.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Value stocks have been outperforming growth very substantially for the first time is years. Non-US stocks have recently outperformed US for the first time in years. The DXY barely rallied mid year and is trending lower.  Bitcoin has gone vertical and looks to be in a blowoff top.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Remember the onslaught of TV ads six months ago, with somber piano accompaniment, messaging “We’re all in this together”. Where did they go?  I suspect that message stopped polling well with focus groups.  Think about it.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Lots of financial market trends quietly reversing.  Will be addressing that in the weeks ahead.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The Mighty Bills.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Mnuchin is declining to extend most of the Fed’s emergency credit programs beyond year-end & asking the Fed to return all unused CARES Act risk capital. This move shuts down the corporate credit programs that propped up markets last spring.  So the training wheels are coming off.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Seems everyday another person I know here in So Cal tells me they’re leaving. Newsome admits he’s been preaching and not practicing his own COVID rules. No shock there; he’s been flaunting his own tax code for years while his FTB audits whistle clean big taxpayers. Why not leave?

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: I read Andrew Yang is supposedly moving to Georgia to influence the crucial Senate run-off elections, encouraging copycats.  No way.  Andrew Yang seems too smart to encourage blatant voter fraud in plain sight.  Am I right Andrew?

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Any governmentally administered public education system (whether national, state, county or city) should be required to fund every student identically.  I believe inequality of educational opportunity is the root of our problems.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Since August 6, 2020 the yield on the 30 Year US Treasury Bond has been rising at a 200 basis point annual rate.  If that continues through August 6, 2021 the Bond’s year-over-year total return will  be approximately -35%!

tweet: It is clear the Buffalo Bills embrace Josh Allen as their leader.  There are few people I would want next to me in the trench more than Josh.  Something special is going on.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Dartmouth required one fall term off, so fall 1979 I took a job as construction laborer, wheelbarrowing rocks out of a build site.  I worked with an ex-con with at least 70 pounds on me (who happened to be black) moving rocks. We were quickly friends.  More of that, less of this.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Listening to both sides of the ever divided national debate is essential.  I find Charlemagne Tha God and Victor Davis Hanson to be sincere voices.  That old “Mount Whitney next to Death Valley” thing again.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: After being at a 10 year high just weeks ago, the MOVE index (a measure of expected future volatility of long term U.S. interest rates) is now at a 10 year low. There it is again!   Mount Whitney is near Death Valley for a reason.  Many layers of meaning in this.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: A Yale “study” last week concluded upping unemployment benefits to levels above what the lost  jobs were paying does not provide a disincentive to to return to work. Yeah, right.  And winning the lottery motivates the winners to take a second job.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: My 89 year old mother received a $1200 check from the Federal government. She did not understand why the government would be sending her a check she never asked for or wanted. She wants to donate it.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Ignored as a “class identity” in one way I see as a good thing.  Every time I meet a person for the first time, I want to see nothing but that person.  No background, no skin tone, no gender this or that.  But equal opportunity is key.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Per the most recent U.S. census over 60 million Americans are “Hispanic”(census term).  That’s close to 20% of total U.S. population, and growing rapidly.  Talk about an ignored subset of the population in the national debate!

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: In September 1957 Frank Lloyd Wright, then aged 88, appeared on two segments of a great show called “The Mike Wallace Interview”.  I strongly recommend at least two viewings.  So much insight on humanity and issues we still face today.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The Democrats have no leader.  The Republicans have no leader.  Antifa has no leader.  Black Lives Matter has no leader.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The Breakfast Club interview today was so revealing. That Charlamagne Tha God host guy was fantastic.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: 30-year Treasury yields seem as anxious to break out to the upside as a rodeo bronc waiting to buck out of the chute. Fed’s getting clearer they want to keep the bronc in the chute forever. Can they? We’ll see. Surely they won’t last the rodeo 8 seconds if the gate is opened.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: I have to laugh when financial media talking heads aver that China has “leverage” over the U.S. because China owns about $1 Trillion U.S. Treasuries and might sell in “retaliation”.  Heck, the U.S. Treasury “sold” about that amount in April alone!

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: For decades approximately 25% of submitted claims for unemployment benefits were deemed qualified. At present about 75% of these are deemed qualified. It sort of suggests that 2/3 of the stimulus funds are leaking out.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Another two months, another multiple trillion $ relief package proposal. It would bring the running bailout total so far...in just three months...to over 150% of Federal taxes collected in all of the most recent reporting year. “Long Term consequences” not so “long term” anymore.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Mayor Garcetti said “We’ll never be completely open until we have a cure.”  It was reported he said “The city of Los Angeles won’t fully re-open until there is a vaccine”.   A cure is not a vaccine. Why not just report the truth, media?

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: These Trillions Treasury is borrowing is heavily in T-Bills. Chair Powell has stated in plain English he is opposed to negative interest rates. Yet the pressure to go negative on Fed Funds will build as short term borrowing explodes and dominates.  Please, no.  Rates < 0 = Fatal.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Long term Treasury yields are rising, understandably, due to a $4 Trillion growth of the National Debt coming in just the next few months.  The Fed has manipulated “Investment Grade” corporate bond yields to below 3%.  They will certainly want a lower ceiling for Treasury yields.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The U.S. Treasury Department today admitted to a $3 Trillion “borrowing” need in the next quarter.  (I’ll take the “over”.)  If endless borrowing is a viable solution, why did we have any taxation in the first place?

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: If the Fed does start buying ETFs “broadly and in size” in response to recent requests they do so as to not “let down” the buyers who front ran the Fed April 9th will not and should not be well received on Main Street.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Warren Buffet selling all of his airline stocks corroborates the “economic genie is not going back in the bottle” thesis.  In late summer 2007 Warren doubled down on bank stocks (a bad call with hindsight benefit). So this airline bail now is a big deal.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Want to see a chart of the greatest large scale whipsaw of all time?  Look at the price action of the ETF LQD over the past five years and YTD.   Not the end; the beginning.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: If the Fed has not actually been buying Corporate Bonds, even through its shell company, the buyers of Corporate Bonds at today’s prices (maybe > the ultimate default recovery value) are simply hoping to sell to the Fed shell company at today’s or higher prices in the future.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: I am told the Fed has not actually bought any Corporate Bonds via the shell company set up to circumvent the restrictions of the Federal Reserve Act of 1913.  Must be the most effective jawboning success in Fed history if that is true.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Check out my CNBC interview from September 18, 2019.  I just watched it for the first time.  It seems so long ago now.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: I doubt I am the only person frustrated by National-Debt-financed bailouts of companies that leveraged up large to buy back stock to levitate share prices to enrich shareholders and company executives.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The “shock-and-awe” of the last six weeks’ (highly questionable) policies served its short term purpose. But I predict and fear its effect will soon wear off.  If these policies work so well to get back to “normal” we should not still need them.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The NASDAQ Composite Index is down less than 3% YTD.  Doesn’t feel like it....right?...but it  goes to show just how strong that index was from year-end into mid-February.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Awareness is growing that the PPP results in many people “making”more money by not working at their prior job.  That seriously increases the labor costs of “re-opening”, making it impossible for many small businesses to “re-open”.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The word “bailout” needs to be labeled “hate speech” directed toward every citizen who played by the rules.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Massive rally in May WTI.  It’s up to a buck. “Move along.  Nothing to see here.”

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: One thing the Fed cannot do is print gold to meet any delivery requests by the “paper gold” futures owners.  So “paper gold” might be repaid with paper.  Kind of makes sense, actually.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: I spoke about how physical gold is far better that “paper gold” for the opposite but related reason that tanked May WTI today. What if the “paper gold” vehicles wanted to take delivery of their futures and the counter party couldn’t deliver?

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: In my “A Tale of Two Sinks” webcast (now up on replay) I finished warning about the danger of purely financial entities speculating in commodities while unable to take delivery. That happened with May WTI today, driving the price to -$40/bbl.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: WTI futures are down 18% right now overnight.  That’s a lot.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Doing some rough math, it looks like the combined value of the U.S. stock market gains off of the recent lows is roughly equivalent to the combined actual-plus-announced increases in the National Debt.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Job losses in just the past month appear to be greater than all previously added since the bottom of the “Great Recession”. So I guess we’re still in the “Great Recession” even after the extraordinary policies meant to get us out of it. We are now going “all in” on such policies.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The buyers’ “In Fed We Trust” mantra is not the worst idea out there. Underlying it, though, is an inflation “success”.  The economy is obviously producing less, and the Government is spraying money everywhere.  Ever hear of “supply and demand”?

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: U.S. GDP looks to be down 15%ish, unannualized, from its peak. SPX is presently down a similar amount from its peak. Ergo (and I over simplify to make a valid point) stocks now are back to the Feb 19th highs from a valuation perspective. “In Fed We Trust” is all the buyers have.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: If the U.S. Treasury can send stimulus money to those eligible via “direct deposit”, I suppose it could also do “direct withdrawal” from those not eligible.  Several years ago tax checks were asked to be written to the U.S. Treasury, not the IRS.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: What people in financial media don’t seem to understand is that we are never going back to the January 2020 “You blow dry my hair and I’ll blow dry your hair” economy.  Saving money and having a net economically productive skill will be the new cool.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Of course, the Federal Reserve will make some wonky  semantic arguement about why they are “technically” in “compliance”.  Just like the balance sheet expansion program last fall was “not QE”.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: The Federal Reserve is presently acting in blatant non-compliance with the Federal Reserve Act of 1913.  An institution violating the rules of its own charter is de facto admitting that said institution has failed and is fundamentally broken.

name: Jeffrey Gundlach
tweet: Sure glad I closed out all my equity shorts below 19,000 on the DJIA.  Equally glad I put a few back on the last couple of days. If the Fed bails out everyone no one actually gets bailed out. Think about it.
